intro: Ardisia pellucida, commonly known as the translucent ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a bright red, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds. Ardisia pellucida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
